back_cards.example_en: He shared a recollection of his childhood.

back_cards.definition_en: A moment in a narrative context
back_cards.example_en: The story relied on her recollection.

back_cards.definition_en: A process in a daily context
back_cards.example_en: Her recollection helped solve the issue.

back_cards.definition_en: A term in an academic context
back_cards.example_en: The class discussed recollection in psychology.

back_cards.definition_en: Careless or without caution
back_cards.example_en: His reckless driving was dangerous.

back_cards.definition_en: A trait in a daily context
back_cards.example_en: Her reckless decision worried friends.

back_cards.definition_en: A quality in a narrative context
back_cards.example_en: The hero’s reckless act saved the day.

back_cards.definition_en: A behavior in a social context
back_cards.example_en: His reckless words caused a fight.

back_cards.definition_en: A characteristic in a professional context
back_cards.example_en: The reckless plan failed quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: Willing to accept ideas or suggestions
back_cards.example_en: She was receptive to new ideas.

back_cards.definition_en: A quality in a professional context
back_cards.example_en: The team was receptive to feedback.

back_cards.definition_en: A trait in a social context
back_cards.example_en: His receptive attitude built trust.

back_cards.definition_en: A feature in an academic context
back_cards.example_en: The students were receptive to the lesson.

back_cards.definition_en: A characteristic in a narrative context
back_cards.example_en: Her receptive heart welcomed love.
